intro: Spermacoce garuensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, greenish-brown berries that contain several seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Spermacoce garuensis is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
